member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Ptr{ObjectIntersectionTexCoord},int) const
member.summary: Checks if there is an intersection between a line and a given surface. If the function returns true the data about the texture coordinates of the intersection point will be put to ObjectIntersectionTexCoord object. The following objects have individual parameters, that control accuracy of intersection detection for them: ObjectLandscapeTerrain ObjectWaterGlobal
member.param: ObjectIntersectionTexCoord class instance to store corresponding intersection data.
member.returns: true if there is an intersection with a given surface; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getIntersection(int) const
member.summary: Returns a surface intersection flag. This flag indicates if intersections with a given surface are enabled.
member.returns: true if intersections with a given surface are enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Ptr{ObjectIntersectionNormal},int) const
member.summary: Checks if there is an intersection between a line and a given surface. If the function returns true the data about the normal at the intersection point will be put to ObjectIntersectionNormal object. The following objects have individual parameters, that control accuracy of intersection detection for them: ObjectLandscapeTerrain ObjectWaterGlobal
member.param: ObjectIntersectionNormal class instance to store corresponding intersection data.
member.returns: true if there is an intersection with a given surface; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,int,Unigine.Ptr{ObjectIntersection},int) const
member.summary: Checks if there is an intersection between a line and a surface with a given intersection mask. If the function returns true the data about the intersection point will be put to ObjectIntersection object and the number of the first intersected surface will be put to the return variable. The following objects have individual parameters, that control accuracy of intersection detection for them: ObjectLandscapeTerrain ObjectWaterGlobal
member.param: ObjectIntersection class instance to store corresponding intersection data.
member.returns: true if there is an intersection; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Ptr{ObjectIntersection},int) const
member.summary: Checks if there is an intersection between a line and a given surface. If the function returns true the data about the intersection point will be put to ObjectIntersection object. The following objects have individual parameters, that control accuracy of intersection detection for them: ObjectLandscapeTerrain ObjectWaterGlobal
member.param: ObjectIntersection class instance to store corresponding intersection data.
member.returns: true if there is an intersection with a given surface; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,int,Unigine.Ptr{ObjectIntersectionNormal},int) const
member.summary: Checks if there is an intersection between a line and a surface with a given intersection mask. If the function returns true the data about the normal at the intersection point will be put to ObjectIntersectionNormal object and the number of the first intersected surface will be put to the return variable. The following objects have individual parameters, that control accuracy of intersection detection for them: ObjectLandscapeTerrain ObjectWaterGlobal
member.param: ObjectIntersectionNormal class instance to store corresponding intersection data.
member.returns: true if there is an intersection; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,int,Unigine.Ptr{ObjectIntersectionTexCoord},int) const
member.summary: Checks if there is an intersection between a line and a surface with a given intersection mask. If the function returns true the data about the texture coordinates of the intersection point will be put to ObjectIntersectionNormal object and the number of the first intersected surface will be put to the return variable. The following objects have individual parameters, that control accuracy of intersection detection for them: ObjectLandscapeTerrain ObjectWaterGlobal
member.param: ObjectIntersectionTexCoord class instance to store corresponding intersection data.
member.returns: true if there is an intersection; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,int,Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec4,int,int,int) const
member.summary: Checks if there is an intersection between a line and a surface with a given intersection mask. If the function returns true the data about the intersection (point, normal and texture coordinates) and the number of the first intersected surface will be put to corresponding return variables. The following objects have individual parameters, that control accuracy of intersection detection for them: ObjectLandscapeTerrain ObjectWaterGlobal
member.param: Intersection point coordinates. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.
Coordinates of the normal vector to the intersection point. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.
Texture coordinates of the intersection point (vec4, where vec4.xy is for the first (0) UV channel, vec4.zw is for the second (1) UV channel). Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.
Intersected triangle number. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.

Intersected instance number. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.Intersected instance number can be obtained for the following classes:ObjectMeshSkinnedObjectMeshClusterObjectMeshSplineCluster
Intersected surface number. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.
member.returns: true if there is at least one intersection found; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec4,int,int,int) const
member.summary: Checks if there is an intersection between a line and a given surface. If the function returns true the data about the intersection (point, normal and texture coordinates) will be put to corresponding return variables. The following objects have individual parameters, that control accuracy of intersection detection for them: ObjectLandscapeTerrain ObjectWaterGlobal
member.param: Intersection point coordinates. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.
Coordinates of the normal vector to the intersection point. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.
Texture coordinates of the intersection point (vec4, where vec4.xy is for the first (0) UV channel, vec4.zw is for the second (1) UV channel). Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.
Intersected triangle number. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.

Intersected instance number. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.Intersected instance number can be obtained for the following classes:ObjectMeshSkinnedObjectMeshClusterObjectMeshSplineCluster
member.returns: true if there is an intersection with a given surface; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.setMinVisibleDistance(float,int)
member.summary: Updates the minimum visibility distance of a given surface. It is the distance, starting from which the surface begins to fade in until it becomes completely visible.
member.param: Minimum visibility distance, in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead. The default value is -inf.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getMinVisibleDistance(int) const
member.summary: Returns minimum visibility distance of a given surface. It is the distance, starting from which the surface begins to fade in until it becomes completely visible.
member.returns: Minimum visibility distance, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.setMaxVisibleDistance(float,int)
member.summary: Updates the maximum visibility distance of a given surface. It is the distance, starting from which the surface begins to fade out until it becomes completely invisible.
member.param: Maximum visibility distance, in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead. The default value is inf.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getMaxVisibleDistance(int) const
member.summary: Returns the maximum visibility distance of a given surface. It is the distance, starting from which the surface begins to fade out until it becomes completely invisible.
member.returns: Maximum visibility distance, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.setMinFadeDistance(float,int)
member.summary: Updates the minimum fade-in distance of a given surface. Over this distance the surface smoothly becomes visible due to alpha fading. It is counted starting from the minimum visibility distance.
member.param: Minimum fade-in distance, in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getMinFadeDistance(int) const
member.summary: Returns the minimum fade-in distance of a given surface. Over this distance the surface smoothly becomes visible due to alpha fading. It is counted starting from the minimum visibility distance.
member.returns: Minimum fade-in distance, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.setMaxFadeDistance(float,int)
member.summary: Updates the maximum fade-out distance of a given surface. Over this distance the surface smoothly becomes invisible due to alpha fading. It is counted off starting from the maximum visibility distance.
member.param: Maximum fade-out distance, in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getMaxFadeDistance(int) const
member.summary: Returns the maximum fade-out distance. Over this distance the surface smoothly becomes invisible due to alpha fading. It is counted starting from the maximum visibility distance.
member.returns: Maximum fade-out distance, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.setSoundOcclusion(float,int)
member.summary: Sets a new sound occlusion value for the specified surface of the object, that determines how much it affects sounds in case of occlusion. For a sound source to be occluded by the specified surface, at least one bit of its occlusion mask should match the occlusion mask of the sound source. Sound occlusion must be enabled.
member.param: Occlusion value in the range [0.0f, 1.0f] to be set for the specified surface.0.0f - no occlusion, sound volume will stay the same in case of occlusion by the surface.1.0f - maximum occlusion, sound will not be heard at all in case of occlusion by the surface.The default value is0.0f.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getSoundOcclusion(int) const
member.summary: Returns the current sound occlusion value for the specified surface of the object, that determines how much it affects sounds in case of occlusion. For a sound source to be occluded by the specified surface, at least one bit of its occlusion mask should match the occlusion mask of the sound source. Sound occlusion must be enabled.
member.returns: Current occlusion value in the range [0.0f, 1.0f] set for the specified surface.0.0f - no occlusion, sound volume will stay the same in case of occlusion by the surface.1.0f - maximum occlusion, sound will not be heard at all in case of occlusion by the surface.The default value is0.0f.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.setSoundOcclusionMask(int,int)
member.summary: Sets a new sound occlusion mask for the specified surface of the object. For a sound source to be occluded by the specified surface, at least one bit of this mask should match the occlusion mask of the sound source. Each surface has its own occlusion value, that determines how much it affects sounds in case of occlusion. Sound occlusion must be enabled.
member.param: Integer, each bit of which is a mask for sound source occlusion.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getSoundOcclusionMask(int) const
member.summary: Returns sound occlusion mask for the specified surface of the object. For a sound source to be occluded by the specified surface, at least one bit of this mask should match the occlusion mask of the sound source. Each surface has its own occlusion value, that determines how much it affects sounds in case of occlusion. Sound occlusion must be enabled.
member.returns: Integer, each bit of which is a mask for sound source occlusion.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.setPhysicsFriction(float,int)
member.summary: Sets the coefficient of friction for the specified surface. This coefficient allows to model more rough rubbing of surfaces and is opposite to the body's movement direction. Friction parameter values of both surfaces being in contact are considered. The resulting calculated friction depends on the objects' masses and gravity, and the angle between contacting surfaces. The higher the value, the less tendency the body has to slide. Friction is calculated by the contact between physical bodies.
member.param: Friction coefficient value in the range [0.0f, 1.0f] to be set for the specified surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getPhysicsFriction(int) const
member.summary: Returns the current coefficient of friction for the specified surface. This coefficient allows to model more rough rubbing of surfaces and is opposite to the body's movement direction. Friction parameter values of both surfaces being in contact are considered. The resulting calculated friction depends on the objects' masses and gravity, and the angle between contacting surfaces. The higher the value, the less tendency the body has to slide. Friction is calculated by the contact between physical bodies.
member.returns: Current friction coefficient value in the range [0.0f, 1.0f] set for the specified surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.setPhysicsRestitution(float,int)
member.summary: Sets the coefficient of restitution for the specified surface. This coefficient determines the degree of relative kinetic energy retained after a collision. It defines how bouncy the object is by contacting with another object. It depends on the elasticity of the materials of colliding bodies. The simulated restitution, like friction, considers the total value for both objects being in contact. The maximum value of 1.0f models elastic collision. Objects bounce off according to the impulse they get by contact. The minimum value of 0.0f models inelastic collision. Objects do not bounce at all. Restitution is calculated by the contact between physical bodies.
member.param: Restitution coefficient value in the range [0.0f, 1.0f] to be set for the specified surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getPhysicsRestitution(int) const
member.summary: Returns the current coefficient of restitution for the specified surface. This coefficient determines the degree of relative kinetic energy retained after a collision. It defines how bouncy the object is by contacting with another object. It depends on the elasticity of the materials of colliding bodies. The simulated restitution, like friction, considers the total value for both objects being in contact. The maximum value of 1.0f models elastic collision. Objects bounce off according to the impulse they get by contact. The minimum value of 0.0f models inelastic collision. Objects do not bounce at all. Restitution is calculated by the contact between physical bodies.
member.returns: Current restitution coefficient value in the range [0.0f, 1.0f] set for the specified surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.setShadowMode(Object::SURFACE_SHADOW_MODE,int)
member.summary: Sets the shadow mode for the specified surface. To cast a shadow from a light source (Omni, Proj, or World), the surface's shadow mode should be adjusted in accordance with the shadow mode of the light source.
member.param: Surface shadow mode to be set, one of the following:SURFACE_SHADOW_MODE_DYNAMICSURFACE_SHADOW_MODE_MIXED

member.name: M:Unigine.Object.getShadowMode(int) const
member.summary: Returns the shadow mode set for the specified surface. To cast a shadow from a light source (Omni, Proj, or World), the surface's shadow mode should be adjusted in accordance with the shadow mode of the light source.
member.returns: Surface shadow mode, one of the following:SURFACE_SHADOW_MODE_DYNAMICSURFACE_SHADOW_MODE_MIXED

member.summary: Mode to cast shadows only if the surface is lit by a dynamic light source.

member.summary: Mode to cast shadows from both static and dynamic light sources.

member.summary: Enables manual adjustment of all lighting-related settings.

member.summary: Excludes the surface from use in static GI and static reflections and is suitable for dynamic shadows.

member.name: F:Unigine.Object.SURFACE_LIGHTING_MODE_STATIC
member.summary: Optimized for use in static GI, static reflections and cached shadows.

Billboard normal coordinates local to the object.

member.summary: Returns the total number of billboards contained in and managed by Billboards object.
member.returns: Number of billboards.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectBillboards.setTexCoord(int,Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Updates texture coordinates of a given billboard. The default is vec4(1,1,0,0). The first pair of coordinates (x and x) sets texture scale by X and Y axes. For example, by the scale of 2 the texture is repeated twice on the billboard. The second pair (z and w) set texture offset along X and Y axes. For example, by the offset of 0.5 along X axis the texture is repositioned to the right (so that the edge of the texture is rendered in the center).
member.param: Billboard number in range from 0 to the total number of billboards.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectBillboards.getTexCoord(int) const
member.summary: Returns the texture coordinates of a given billboard. The default is vec4(1,1,0,0). The first pair of coordinates (x and x) sets texture scale by X and Y axes. For example, by the scale of 2 the texture is repeated twice on the billboard. The second pair (z and w) set texture offset along X and Y axes. For example, by the offset of 0.5 along X axis the texture is repositioned to the right (so that the edge of the texture is rendered in the center).
member.param: Billboard number in range from 0 to the total number of billboards.
member.returns: Texture coordinates.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectBillboards.setWidth(int,float)
member.summary: Updates a width of a given billboard.
member.param: Billboard number in range from 0 to the total number of billboards.
Width of the billboard, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectBillboards.getWidth(int) const
member.summary: Returns the current width of a given billboard.
member.param: Billboard number in range from 0 to the total number of billboards.
member.returns: Width of the billboard, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectBillboards.addBillboard(float,float)
member.summary: Adds a billboard with given width and height to be managed by the Billboards object. A position, texture coordinates and an angle of the new billboard are set to default: position is set to vec3(0,0,0) texture coordinates are set to vec4(1,1,0,0) angle is set to 0.
member.param: Width of the billboard, in units.
Height of the billboard, in units.
member.returns: Number of the added billboard.

member.summary: Returns the type of the node.
member.returns: Object type identifier.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectBillboards.saveStateSelf(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream}) const
member.summary: Saves the object's state to the specified stream. This method saves all object's parameters including the list of billboards.To save the object's billboards only, use saveStateBillboards(). Saving into the stream requires creating a blob to save into. To restore the saved state the restoreStateSelf() method is used:
member.returns: true on success; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectBillboards.restoreStateSelf(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream})
member.summary: Restores the object's state from the specified stream. This method restores all object's parameters including the list of billboards. To restore the object's billboards only, use restoreStateBillboards(). Restoring from the stream requires creating a blob to save into and saving the state using the saveStateSelf() method:
member.returns: true on success; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectBillboards.saveStateBillboards(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream}) const
member.summary: Saves the state of the object's billboards to the specified stream. Saving into the stream requires creating a blob to save into. To restore the saved state the restoreStateBillboards() method is used:
member.returns: true on success; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectBillboards.restoreStateBillboards(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream})
member.summary: Restores the state of the object's billboards from the specified stream. Restoring from the stream requires creating a blob to save into and saving the state using the saveStateBillboards() method:
member.returns: true on success; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Sets the number of the vertex attributes. The example of setting 4 different vertices attributes:
member.param: Number of the vertex attributes, can be up to 16 attributes for one vertex. The numeration starts from 0. Each attribute consists of:An offset of the vertex in bytes, depends on the vertex type and size.Type of the vertex: TYPE_FLOAT, TYPE_HALF, TYPE_UCHARSize of the vertex: can be 1,2,3,4 for float type; 2,4 for half type; 4 for UChar typeWhen it goes to shader, 0 -attribute always comes with the size of 4, no matter what size is specified in the method. All the other attributes comes with the specified sizes.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectDynamic.allocateIndices(int)
member.summary: Allocate an index buffer for a given number of indices that will be used for an object. With this function, memory can be allocated once rather than in chunks, making the creation faster.
member.param: The number of indices that will be stored in a buffer.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectDynamic.allocateVertex(int)
member.summary: Allocate a vertex buffer for a given number of vertices that will be used for an object. With this function, memory can be allocated once rather than in chunks, making the creation faster.
member.param: The number of vertices that will be stored in a buffer.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectDynamic.clearIndices
member.summary: Clears all the vertex indices in the object.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectDynamic.clearSurfaces
member.summary: Clears all the surface settings.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectDynamic.clearVertex
member.summary: Clears all the current vertex settings.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectDynamic.flushIndices
member.summary: Flushes the index buffer and sends all data to GPU. If you change the contents of the index buffers, you should call this method.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectDynamic.flushVertex
member.summary: Flushes the vertex buffer and sends all data to GPU. This method is called automatically, if the length of the vertex buffer changes. If you change the contents of the vertex buffers, you should call this method.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectDynamic.removeIndices(int,int)
member.summary: Removes the specified number of indices starting from the given index.
member.param: Number of the index in the index buffer.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectDynamic.removeVertex(int,int,int)
member.summary: Removes the specified number of vertices starting from the given vertex. To fix the index buffer after removal of vertices, pass 1 as the 3rd argument.
member.param: Number of the vertex in the vertex buffer.
1 to fix the index buffer after removal of vertices; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectExtern.setMaterialNodeType(int)
member.summary: Sets the node type to be used by the renderer to determine which materials can be applied to the object. As ObjectExtern is a custom user-defined object, so the user should determine the node type for the renderer to treat this object properly. Setting inappropriate node type may lead to system crashes.
member.param: Node type ID. One of the node type identifiers.

member.summary: Returns the node type to be used by the renderer to determine which materials can be applied to the object. As ObjectExtern is a custom user-defined object, so the user should determine the node type for the renderer to treat this object properly. Setting inappropriate node type may lead to system crashes.
member.returns: Node type ID. One of the node type identifiers.

member.summary: Returns a value indicating that the line intersects the object surface.

Coordinates of the end point of the line.
Intersection point coordinates. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.
Intersection normal vector. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.
Intersection texture coordinates. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.
Intersected triangle number. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.
Intersected instance number. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.
member.returns: Returns 1 if the intersection occurs.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.setMaskMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},int)
member.summary: Sets a mesh to be used as a mask on-the-fly. Limitations: Before the method is called, another mesh must be set via setMaskMeshName() first. If the world is reloaded, the mesh set via setMaskMeshName() will be loaded. If the memory limit is exceeded, the new mesh might be replaced with the mesh set via setMaskMeshName().
member.param: Invalidate flag. Set 1 to invalidate all grass cells; otherwise, set 0. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.
member.returns: 1 if the mesh is set successfully; otherwise - 0.

member.summary: Copies the current mask mesh (if it exists) to the specified target mesh.
member.param: Pointer to the mesh to copy the current mask mesh to.
member.returns: 1 if mesh mask exists; otherwise - 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.setMaxBend(Unigine.Math.vec4,Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Sets the maximum grass bending parameters (rendered in areas with the highest density according to the mask). Bend angles (mean and spread) are defined for four diffuse texture columns. The resulting value is determined as follows: Result = Mean + Random * Spread, where Random is a random value in range from -1 to 1.
member.param: Vector of mean values of grass bending angles to be set for four diffuse texture columns.
Vector of spread values of grass bending angles to be set for four diffuse texture columns.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getMaxBendMean const
member.summary: Returns the mean value for the maximum grass bending (rendered in areas with the highest density according to the mask). Bend angles are defined for four diffuse texture columns.
member.returns: Vector of mean values of grass bending angles for four diffuse texture columns.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getMaxBendSpread const
member.summary: Returns the spread value for the maximum grass bending (rendered in areas with the highest density according to the mask). Bend angles are defined for four diffuse texture columns.
member.returns: Vector of spread values of grass bending angles for four diffuse texture columns.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.setMinBend(Unigine.Math.vec4,Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Sets the minimum grass bending parameters (rendered in areas with the lowest density according to the mask). Bend angles (mean and spread) are defined for four diffuse texture columns. The resulting value is determined as follows: Result = Mean + Random * Spread, where Random is a random value in range from -1 to 1.
member.param: Vector of mean values of grass bending angles to be set for four diffuse texture columns.
Vector of spread values of grass bending angles to be set for four diffuse texture columns.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getMinBendMean const
member.summary: Returns the mean value for the minimum grass bending (rendered in areas with the lowest density according to the mask). Bend angles are defined for four diffuse texture columns.
member.returns: Vector of mean values of grass bending angles for four diffuse texture columns.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getMinBendSpread const
member.summary: Returns the spread value for the minimum grass bending (rendered in areas with the lowest density according to the mask). Bend angles are defined for four diffuse texture columns.
member.returns: Vector of spread values of grass bending angles for four diffuse texture columns.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.setMaxHeight(Unigine.Math.vec4,Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Sets the maximum grass height (rendered in areas with the highest density according to the mask). The height is defined for four diffuse texture columns, as mean and spread values ( Result = Mean + Random * Spread, where Random is a random value in range from -1 to 1).
member.param: Mean value for the maximum grass height in units. If a negative value is provided, EPSILON will be used instead.
Spread value for the maximum grass height in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getMaxHeightMean const
member.summary: Returns the mean value for the maximum grass height (rendered in areas with the highest density according to the mask). The height is defined for four diffuse texture columns.
member.returns: Mean value for the maximum grass height in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getMaxHeightSpread const
member.summary: Returns the spread value for the maximum grass height (rendered in areas with the highest density according to the mask). The height is defined for four diffuse texture columns.
member.returns: Spread value for the maximum grass height in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.setMinHeight(Unigine.Math.vec4,Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Sets the minimum grass height (rendered in areas with the lowest density according to the mask). The height is defined for four diffuse texture columns, as mean and spread values ( Result = Mean + Random * Spread, where Random is a random value in range from -1 to 1).
member.param: Mean value for the minimum grass height in units. If a negative value is provided, EPSILON will be used instead.
Spread value for the minimum grass height in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getMinHeightMean const
member.summary: Returns the mean value for the minimum grass height (rendered in areas with the lowest density according to the mask). The height is defined for four diffuse texture columns.
member.returns: Mean value for the minimum grass height in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getMinHeightSpread const
member.summary: Returns the spread value for the minimum grass height (rendered in areas with the lowest density according to the mask). The height is defined for four diffuse texture columns.
member.returns: Spread value for the minimum grass height in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getOrientation const
member.summary: Returns a flag indicating if grass polygons are oriented along the normal of its parent (for example, a terrain).
member.returns: 1 if the grass is oriented along the normals of the ground; 0 if it always points upwards.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.setProbability(Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Sets the grass rendering probability per column (in the diffuse texture). The higher the value for some column, the more frequently it will be rendered.
member.param: Per-column probability. Any values can be set, since they are normalized.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getProbability const
member.summary: Returns the current grass rendering probability per column (in the diffuse texture). The higher the value for some column, the more frequently it will be rendered.
member.returns: Per-column probability.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.setRotation(Unigine.Math.vec4,Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Sets the grass rotation. Rotation is defined for four diffuse texture columns, as mean and spread values ( Result = Mean + Random * Spread, where Random is a random value in range from -1 to 1).
member.param: Mean value of grass polygons rotation, in degrees.
Spread value of grass polygons rotation, in degrees.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getRotationMean const
member.summary: Returns the current mean value for the grass rotation, defined for four diffuse texture columns.
member.returns: Mean value of grass polygons rotation, in degrees.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getRotationSpread const
member.summary: Returns the current spread value for the grass rotation, defined for four diffuse texture columns.
member.returns: Spread value of grass polygons rotation, in degrees.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getSeed const
member.summary: Returns the seed used for pseudo-random positioning of grass.
member.returns: Number used to initialize a pseudo-random sequence.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.setStep(float)
member.summary: Sets the step for cells used to render grass.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getStep const
member.summary: Returns the current step for cells used to render grass.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.setSubdivision(int)
member.summary: Subdivide grass rendering cells into smaller sub-cells. It is used if a grass node is used as a distant LOD for WorldClutter or ObjectMeshClutter with smaller cells. This way, positions of randomly scattered objects will coincide with those of grass-based impostors.
member.param: Divisor for cells. The value is clamped to a range [1;32].

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getSubdivision const
member.summary: Returns the current divisor used to subdivide grass rendering cells into smaller sub-cells. Subdividing is used if a grass node is used as a distant LOD for WorldClutter or ObjectMeshClutter with smaller cells. This way, positions of randomly scattered objects will coincide with those of grass-based impostors.
member.returns: Divisor for cells.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.setThinning(int)
member.summary: Sets a flag to thin out grass with a distance (random grass polygons are not rendered across the grass Fade distance).
member.param: 1 to thin out the grass; 0 to render all grass polygons at the distance.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getThinning const
member.summary: Returns a flag indicating if the grass is thinned out with a distance (random grass polygons are not rendered across the grass Fade distance).
member.returns: 1 if the grass is thinned out; 0 if all grass polygons are rendered at the distance.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.setThreshold(float)
member.summary: Sets the threshold for density, starting from which the grass will be rendered.
member.param: Threshold value in range from 0 to 1.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getThreshold const
member.summary: Returns the current threshold for density, starting from which the grass is rendered.
member.returns: Threshold value.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.setVariation(int)
member.summary: Sets the random horizontal flip for grass polygons.
member.param: 1 to enable grass flipping, 0 to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getVariation const

member.returns: 1 if grass flipping is enabled; otherwise, 0.

member.summary: Returns the type of the node.
member.returns: Object type identifier.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.invalidate
member.summary: Invalidates all grass cells. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.invalidate(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox)
member.summary: Invalidates all grass cells within the area specified by the given bounding box. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.
member.param: Bounding box, defining the area, where grass cells will be regenerated.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.setCutoutIntersectionMask(int)
member.summary: Sets a new cutout intersection mask. This mask allows you to cut out the grass in the areas of intersection with objects and decals (e.g. can be used to remove grass under houses or from the surface of roads projected using decals). The grass will be cut out by objects and decals that have their intersection mask matching this one (one bit at least). To set intersection masks the following methods can be used: for decals use getIntersectionMask() for objects use getIntersectionMask()
member.param: Integer, each bit of which is a mask.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getCutoutIntersectionMask const
member.summary: Returns the current cutout intersection mask. This mask allows you to cut out the grass in the areas of intersection with objects and decals (e.g. can be used to remove grass under houses or from the surface of roads projected using decals). The grass will be cut out by objects and decals that have their intersection mask matching this one (one bit at least). To set intersection masks the following methods can be used: for decals use getIntersectionMask() for objects use getIntersectionMask()
member.returns: Integer, each bit of which is a mask.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.setCutoutInverse(int)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the grass should be rendered inside or outside the areas determined by the cutout intersection mask.
member.param: 0 to render the grass outside the areas determined by the cutout intersection mask; 1 to render the grass inside these areas.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getCutoutInverse const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the grass is rendered inside or outside the areas determined by the cutout intersection mask.
member.returns: 0 if the grass is rendered outside the areas determined by the cutout intersection mask; 1 if inside.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.#ctor(char,char,bool)
member.summary: An ObjectGuiMesh constructor. The ObjectGuiMesh will be created on the basis of the specified mesh.
member.param: Name of the new GUI mesh.

When you create several objects out of a single .mesh file, the instance of the mesh geometry is created. If you then change the source geometry, its instances will be changed as well. To avoid this, set the unique flag to 1, so a copy of the mesh geometry will be created and changes won't be applied.This argument is available only if the first argument is string.

member.name: M:Unigine.Landscape.asyncTextureDraw(int,Unigine.UGUID,Unigine.Math.ivec2,Unigine.Math.ivec2,int,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Commences an asynchronous GPU-based drawing operation with forced pre-loading of terrain data within the specified bounding box (all landscape layer maps). The drawing operation represents modification of the texture buffer of the specified size taken at specified coordinates and combining data layers defined by the specified flags. The operation itself is to be implemented in the TextureDrawCallback handler. This method can be used for implementing GPU-based terrain modification (e.g. brushes) that requires additional data beyond the area specified by coords and resolution parameters as well as the data of other landscape layer maps (e.g. a copy brush).
member.param: GUID of the landscape layer map file to be modified.
Coordinates of the upper left corner of the landscape layer map data segment to be modified along the X and Y axes.
Resolution of the landscape layer map data segment to be modified along the X and Y axes.
Data layer mask. A combination of FLAGS_FILE_DATA_* flags indicating data layers to be affected (heights, albedo, certain masks).
Bounding box (world) specifying the area containing terrain tiles (all landscape layer maps) to be loaded to memory prior to making modifications.

member.name: M:Unigine.Landscape.asyncTextureDraw(int,Unigine.UGUID,Unigine.Math.ivec2,Unigine.Math.ivec2,int)

The drawing operation represents modification of the texture buffer of the specified size taken at specified coordinates and combining data layers defined by the specified flags. member.param: GUID of the landscape layer map file to be modified.

Resolution of the landscape layer map data segment to be modified along the X and Y axes.
Data layer mask. A combination of FLAGS_FILE_DATA_* flags indicating data layers to be affected (heights, albedo, certain masks).

member.name: M:Unigine.Landscape.isFilesClosed
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if .lmap files for all landscape layer maps are closed. Call this method before making any changes (modification, deletion, renaming) to .lmap files of the landscape terrain object to ensure that these files are not currently used by the Engine to avoid conflicts. If not, you can use the filesClose() method co close them.
member.returns: true if .lmap files for all landscape layer maps are closed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Landscape.filesClose(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.UGUID,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Closes .lmap files for all landscape layer maps and reloads the ones with specified GUIDs. This method should be called before making any changes (modification, deletion, renaming) to .lmap files of the landscape terrain object to avoid conflicts, as these files are streamed continuosly by the Engine. Thus, by calling this method you inform the Engine that it should stop streaming terrain data. The list informs the Engine which files are no longer valid and should be reloaded or removed. As you're done with modification you should call the filesOpen() method to resume streaming operations.
member.param: List of GUIDs of .lmap files to be reloaded. This list should contain .lmap files, that were deleted or having their data changed (albedo, heights, masks). If there are no such files, you can simply call the filesClose() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Landscape.filesClose
member.summary: Closes .lmap files for all landscape layer maps. This method should be called before making any changes (modification, deletion, renaming) to .lmap files of the landscape terrain object to avoid conflicts, as these files are streamed continuosly by the Engine. Thus, by calling this method you inform the Engine that it should stop streaming terrain data. As you're done with modification you should call the filesOpen() method to resume streaming operations.

member.name: M:Unigine.Landscape.filesOpen
member.summary: Opens .lmap files for all landscape layer maps. This method should be called after making any changes (modification, deletion, renaming) to .lmap files of the landscape terrain object. Prior to making such modifications the filesClose() method should be called.

member.name: F:Unigine.Landscape.COMPRESSOR_TYPE_NONE
member.summary: No compression is used.

member.name: F:Unigine.Landscape.COMPRESSOR_TYPE_JACKALLESS
member.summary: Our Method compression is used. It is optimized for compressing 2D and 3D textures and provides better results than LZ4 and Zlib without deteriorating the quality.

member.name: F:Unigine.Landscape.COMPRESSOR_TYPE_LZ4
member.summary: LZ4 compression is used (temporary option, planned to be removed in the upcoming releases).

member.name: F:Unigine.Landscape.COMPRESSOR_TYPE_ZLIB
member.summary: Zlib compression (can provide up to 2 times higher compression ratio, but takes up to 20 times longer).

member.name: F:Unigine.Landscape.ALPHA_BLEND
member.summary: Alpha blending mode - the colors of the layer map and the underlying one are blended.

member.name: F:Unigine.Landscape.ADDITIVE
member.summary: Additive blending mode - data of the layer map is added atop of the data of underlying maps.

member.name: F:Unigine.Landscape.OVERLAY
member.summary: Overlay blending mode - data of the layer map replaces the data of underlying maps.

member.name: F:Unigine.Landscape.MULTIPLICATIVE
member.summary: Multiplicative blending mode - albedo colors of the underlying map are multiplied by the colors of the layer map.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeLayerMap.setCulling(bool)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating if heights data of the layer map is to be used for culling precalculation. In order to define which parts of the terrain are to be rendered a culling test is required. This test is performed on the basis of a precalculated low-detail height map, combining heights data of all landscape layer maps having a significant impact on the result. Precalculation is performed on the CPU side, so processing a large number of landscape layer maps may reduce performance. Moreover, some layer maps may be used as decals (i.e. their impact on the resulting height map is insignificant). For such cases you can simply disable this option to avoid unnecessary calculations. Disabling this option for a single
member.param: true to use the layer map for culling, false - to ignore it.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeLayerMap.isCulling const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if heights data of the layer map is to be used for culling precalculation. In order to define which parts of the terrain are to be rendered a culling test is required. This test is performed on the basis of a precalculated low-detail height map, combining heights data of all landscape layer maps having a significant impact on the result. Precalculation is performed on the CPU side, so processing a large number of landscape layer maps may reduce performance. Moreover, some layer maps may be used as decals (i.e. their impact on the resulting height map is insignificant). For such cases you can simply disable this option to avoid unnecessary calculations.
member.returns: true if heights data of the layer map is to be used for culling precalculation; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeMapFileCreator.run(bool,bool)
member.summary: Runs the landscape map file creation process. You can set callbacks to be fired in the beginning, upon completion and during the process to monitor progress and display statistics. Creates the landscape map file path if it doesnt exist yet (including subdirectories).
member.param: true to create an empty .lmap file (e.g., when you create a layer map to be manually sculpted from scratch using brushes), false - to get necessary data from the sources and put them to the generated .lmap file.

true to make the Engine automatically call filesClose()/fileOpen() methods when performing operations (before modifying an .lmap file the Engine should release files via filesClose(), while after modification fileOpen() should be called), false - to call filesClose()/fileOpen() methods manually.The Landscape class has two overloads for the filesClose() method:filesClose() - to be called in case of moving an .lmap file (no data reloading is performed as the file itself was not modified - saves time on reloading data)filesClose(reload_files) - to be called in case of deleting or modifying an .lmap file.When is_safe = true the Engine shall always call filesClose(reload_files) with complete data reloading.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeMapFileCompression.compress(bool)
member.summary: Starts the landscape map file compression process.
member.param: true to make the Engine automatically call filesClose()/fileOpen() methods when performing operations (before modifying an .lmap file the Engine should release files via filesClose(), while after modification fileOpen() should be called), false to call filesClose()/fileOpen() methods manually.The Landscape class has two overloads for the filesClose() method:filesClose() to be called in case of moving an .lmap file (no data reloading is performed as the file itself was not modified saves time on reloading data)filesClose(reload_files) to be called in case of deleting or modifying an .lmap file.When is_safe = true the Engine shall always call filesClose(reload_files) with complete data reloading.
member.returns: true if the compression operation is successful; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeMapFileCompression.decompress(bool)
member.summary: Starts the landscape map file decompression process.
member.param: true to make the Engine automatically call filesClose()/fileOpen() methods when performing operations (before modifying an .lmap file the Engine should release files via filesClose(), while after modification fileOpen() should be called), false to call filesClose()/fileOpen() methods manually.The Landscape class has two overloads for the filesClose() method:filesClose() to be called in case of moving an .lmap file (no data reloading is performed as the file itself was not modified saves time on reloading data)filesClose(reload_files) to be called in case of deleting or modifying an .lmap file.When is_safe = true the Engine shall always call filesClose(reload_files) with complete data reloading.
member.returns: true if the decompression operation is successful; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeMapFileCompression.stop
member.summary: Stops the landscape map file compression/decompression process.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeMapFileCompression.setCacheDirectory(char)
member.summary: Sets a path to the directory that is used to store the cache. By default the cache is located in the same place where the UnigineEditor's cache is (you can find it in the UnigineEditor Settings tab). If there is not enough memory, you can use another disk. A full copy of the current terrain will be temporarily stored in the cache directory, so you should take this into account when estimating the cache size. SSD is recommended for fast data copying.
member.param: The path to the directory that stores the cache.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeMapFileCompression.getCacheDirectory const
member.summary: Returns the current path to the directory that is used to store the cache.
member.returns: The path to the directory that stores the cache.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.setUsesHeight(bool)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating if heights data is engaged in the fetch/intersection request. When the data type is engaged, you can obtain it via the corresponding get() method. Disengaging unnecessary data when performing requests saves some performance (e.g., you can engage albedo data only if you need only color information at a certain point). This option is enabled by default.
member.param: true to engage height data in the fetch/intersection request, false - to disengage.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.isUsesHeight
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if heights data is engaged in the fetch/intersection request. When the data type is engaged, you can obtain it via the corresponding get() method. Disengaging unnecessary data when performing requests saves some performance (e.g., you can engage albedo data only if you need only color information at a certain point). This option is enabled by default.
member.returns: true if heights data is engaged in the fetch/intersection request; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Sets a value indicating if normals data is engaged in the fetch/intersection request. When the data type is engaged, you can obtain it via the corresponding get() method. Disengaging unnecessary data when performing requests saves some performance (e.g., you can engage albedo data only if you need only color information at a certain point).Enable this option to get normal information for the point.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.fetchForce
member.summary: Fetches terrain data in forced mode for the point specified by the setFetchPosition(). You can use the fetchAsync() method to reduce load, when an instant result is not required.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.fetchForce(Unigine.Math.Vec2)

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.intersectionForce
member.summary: Performs tracing along the line from the p0 point specified by the setIntersectionPositionBegin() to the p1 point specified by the setIntersectionPositionEnd() to find an intersection with the terrain in forced mode. You can use the intersectionAsync() method to reduce load, when an instant result is not required.
member.returns: true if an intersection with the terrain was found; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.intersectionForce(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3)
member.summary: Performs tracing along the line from the p0 point to the p1 point to find an intersection with the terrain in forced mode. You can use the intersectionAsync() method to reduce load, when an instant result is not required.
member.returns: true if an intersection with the terrain was found; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.fetchAsync(bool)
member.summary: Fetches terrain data for the point specified by the setFetchPosition() in asynchronous mode (the corresponding task shall be put to the queue, to wait until the result is obtained use the wait() method). For an instant result use the fetchForce() method.
member.param: true to set high priority for the fetch task, false - to set normal priority.

For an instant result use the intersectionForce() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeImages.#ctor(Unigine.Math.ivec2)
member.summary: Creates a new LandscapeImages object to store the data for a terrain area of the specified resolution.
member.param: Two-component vector containing image resolution along X and Y axes.
member.returns: LandscapeImages instance - a data container for a terrain area of the specified size.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeImages.getHeight
member.summary: Returns height data as an image.
member.returns: Image (R32F) containing height data.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeImages.getAlbedo
member.summary: Returns albedo data as an RGBA8 image. Opacity data is stored in the alpha-channel.
member.returns: Image (RGBA8) containing albedo data.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeImages.getMask(int)
member.summary: Returns mask data as an RGBA8 image.Each detail mask can be represented by a single-channel image. For optimization purposes detail mask data is stored in blocks - RGBA8 images (each containing 4 masks, one mask per each channel). There are 5 blocks, as the terrain has 20 detail masks available. Thus, the data of the 9th detail mask shall be stored in the R-channel of the third block (index = 2).
member.returns: Image (RGBA8) containing mask data.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeImages.getOpacityHeight
member.summary: Returns opacity information for height data as an R32F image.
member.returns: Image (R32F) containing opacity information for height data.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeImages.getOpacityMask(int)
member.summary: Returns opacity information for mask data as an RGBA8 image. Each mask can be represented by a single-channel image. For optimization purposes opacity information for mask data is stored in blocks - RGBA8 images (each containing 4 masks, one mask per each channel). There are 5 blocks, as the terrain has 20 detail masks available. Thus, the data of the 9th detail mask shall be stored in the R-channel of the third block (index = 2).
member.returns: Image (RGBA8) containing opacity information for mask data.

member.name: M:Unigine.LandscapeImages.get(int)
member.summary: Returns the image of the specified type.
member.param: Landscape map data type identifier. One of the LANDSCAPE_TYPE_FILE_DATA_* values.
member.returns: Image of the specified type.

member.returns: Two-component vector containing image resolution along X and Y axes.

member.summary: Sets a new image resolution.
member.param: Two-component vector containing new image resolution along X and Y axes to be set.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.#ctor(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh})
member.summary: ObjectMeshStatic constructor. Creates a new mesh object from a given file.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.ObjectMeshStatic(char,bool)
member.summary: ObjectMeshStatic constructor. Creates a new mesh object from a given file.
member.param: A variable of one of the following types:Mesh mesh - The source mesh.string name - The path to the .mesh file.

When you create several objects out of a single .mesh file, the instance of the mesh geometry is created. If you then change the source geometry, its instances will be changed as well. To avoid this, set the unique flag to true (1), so a copy of the mesh geometry will be created and changes won't be applied.

member.summary: Sets the new coordinate index for the given vertex of the given surface.
member.param: Vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of coordinate indices for the given surface.To get the total number of coordinate indices for the given surface, use the getNumCIndices() method.

Coordinate index to be set in the range from 0 to the total number of coordinate vertices for the given surface.To get the total number of coordinate vertices for the given surface, use the getNumVertex() method.

member.summary: Returns the coordinate index for the given vertex of the given surface.
member.param: Vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of coordinate indices for the given surface.To get the total number of coordinate indices for the given surface, use the getNumCIndices() method.
member.returns: Coordinate index.

member.summary: Returns the color of the given triangle vertex of the given surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.setMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},bool)
member.summary: Copies a given source mesh into the current mesh. For example, you can copy a mesh into another one as follows:
member.param: Unique flag used when you create several objects out of a single Mesh instance :false (0) - An instance of source mesh geometry is created. If the source geometry is changed at runtime, its instances will be changed as well.true (1) - A copy of source mesh geometry is created and changes made to the source geometry do not affect the mesh.
member.returns: true if the mesh is copied successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.#ctor(char,bool)
member.summary: ObjectMeshCluster constructor.
member.param: When you create several objects out of a single .mesh file, the instance of the mesh geometry is created. If you then change the source geometry, its instances will be changed as well. To avoid this, set the unique flag to true (1), so a copy of the mesh geometry will be created and changes won't be applied.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.setFadeDistance(float)
member.summary: Sets the distance up to which meshes handled by the mesh cluster will be fading out (that is, fewer meshes will be rendered instead of all). The distance is measured starting from the visible distance. The default is 0. Using fade distance allows the objects to disappear one by one until up to the fade distance only a few left. It makes the disappearing smooth and much less noticeable.
member.param: Fading distance for meshes in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getFadeDistance const
member.summary: Returns the distance up to which meshes handled by the mesh cluster will be fading out. The default is 0.
member.returns: Fading distance for meshes in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.setMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh})
member.summary: Copies the source mesh into the current mesh.
member.returns: 1 if the mesh is copied successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}) const
member.summary: Copies the current mesh into the target mesh.
member.returns: 1 if the mesh is copied successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.setMeshName(char)
member.summary: Sets a new path to the mesh handled by the mesh cluster. Does not update mesh immediately using the new path, unlike the setMeshNameForce() method.
member.param: Path to the mesh to be set.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.setMeshNameForce(char)
member.summary: Sets a new path to the mesh handled by the mesh cluster and forces mesh creation using the new path. The new mesh is created from the specified path immediately with the unique flag set to 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getMeshName const
member.summary: Returns the path to the mesh handled by a mesh cluster.
member.returns: Path to the mesh.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.addMeshTransform
member.summary: Adds a new mesh instance transformation to the cluster. To set the new added transformation pass the return value of this method to the setMeshTransform() method.
member.returns: Number of the last added mesh instance.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.setMeshTransform(int,Unigine.Math.mat4)
member.summary: Sets the transformation for the given mesh instance.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getMeshTransform(int) const
member.summary: Returns the transformation of the given mesh instance.
member.returns: Mesh transformation matrix.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.removeMeshTransform(int)
member.summary: Removes the transformation of the specified mesh instance from the cluster.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.removeMeshTransformFast(int)
member.summary: Removes the transformation of the specified mesh instance from the cluster.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.updateSpatialTree
member.summary: Updates the spatial tree of the mesh cluster. Spatial tree is updated in the next frame, this method can be used to update the tree immediately.

Buffer to store transformations of detached cluster meshes.

Buffer to store transformations of cluster meshes, in world coordinates.

member.summary: Collects transformations (local coordinates) for all cluster meshes within the area specified by the given bounding box and puts them to the specified buffer.

Buffer to store transformations of cluster meshes.

Buffer to store transformations of cluster meshes, in world coordinates.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.#ctor(char,bool)
member.summary: ObjectMeshClutter constructor.
member.param: When you create several objects out of a single .mesh file, the instance of the mesh geometry is created. If you then change the source geometry, its instances will be changed as well. To avoid this, set the unique flag to true (1), so a copy of the mesh geometry will be created and changes won't be applied.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getCollision const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if collisions with the object should be taken into account. If the return value is false the new geometry will never be generated by collision detection request.

member.returns: Density factor.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setFadeDistance(float)
member.summary: Sets the distance up to which meshes scattered by the mesh clutter will be fading out (that is, fewer meshes will be rendered instead of all). The distance is measured starting from the visible distance. In order for a fade distance to be applied, visibility distance should not be infinite.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getFadeDistance const

The distance is measured starting from the visible distance. In order for a fade distance to be applied, visibility distance should not be infinite.
member.returns: Distance of nodes fading in units.

If the world is reloaded, the mesh set via setMaskMeshName() will be loaded. If the memory limit is exceeded, the new mesh might be replaced with the mesh set via setMaskMeshName().

member.summary: Creates the clutter mesh with the specified parameters.
member.param: When you create several objects out of a single .mesh file, the instance of the mesh geometry is created. If you then change the source geometry, its instances will be changed as well. member.returns: true if the mesh is created successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.clearClutterExcludes
member.summary: Restores all cells removed by the calls to the setClutterExclude() method. Restored cells will be regenerated.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setClutterExclude(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox,int)
member.summary: Removes all cells within the area specified by the given bounding box. Generation of these cells will be skipped. This method can be used to replace some parts of the clutter with modified meshes (e.g., broken trees within the area around the shell crater in the forest).
member.param: Bounding box, defining the area, where mesh clutter cells will not be generated.
Exclude flag. Set 1 to remove all mesh clutter cells within the area; otherwise, set 0 to restore the removed ones. Restored cells will be regenerated.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getClutterTransforms(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},bool,bool) const
member.summary: Collects transformations for all clutter meshes in the generated cells within the area specified by the given bounding box and puts them to the specified buffer. Generation of clutter cells is performed in separate threads. Some of the cells may have their lifetime expired. Therefore, the content of certain cells might be unavailable at the moment, such cells are considered as not generated.
member.param: Bounding box, defining the area, for which the transformations of clutter meshes are to be collected.
Buffer to store transformations of clutter meshes.

Precision flag:1 - transformations will be collected for clutter meshes within the specified bounding box0 - transformations will be collected for clutter meshes within the cells intersected by the specified bounding box

Force flag.1 - regenerate all cells within the area, that were not generated, before collecting transformations for the meshes inside them.0 - transformations will be collected only for the meshes inside the clutter cells, that were generated.
member.returns: 1, if there are transformations of clutter meshes; or 0, if there are no transformations of clutter meshes found.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getClutterTransforms(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
member.summary: Collects transformations for all clutter meshes within the generated cells and puts them to the specified buffer. Generation of clutter cells is performed in separate threads. Some of the cells may have their lifetime expired. Therefore, the content of certain cells might be unavailable at the moment, such cells are considered as not generated.
member.param: Buffer to store transformations of clutter meshes.
member.returns: 1, if there are transformations of clutter meshes; or 0, if there are no transformations of clutter meshes found.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getClutterWorldTransforms(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.Mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},bool,bool) const
member.summary: Collects transformations (in world coordinates) for all clutter meshes in the generated cells within the area specified by the given bounding box and puts them to the specified buffer. Generation of clutter cells is performed in separate threads. Some of the cells may have their lifetime expired. Therefore, the content of certain cells might be unavailable at the moment, such cells are considered as not generated.
member.param: Bounding box, defining the area, for which the transformations of clutter meshes are to be collected.
Buffer to store transformations of clutter meshes, in world coordinates.

Precision flag:1 - transformations will be collected for clutter meshes within the specified bounding box0 - transformations will be collected for clutter meshes within the cells intersected by the specified bounding box

Force flag.1 - regenerate all cells within the area, that were not generated, before collecting transformations for the meshes inside them.0 - transformations will be collected only for the meshes inside the clutter cells, that were generated.
member.returns: 1, if there are transformations of clutter meshes; or 0, if there are no transformations of clutter meshes found.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getClutterWorldTransforms(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.Mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
member.summary: Collects transformations (in world coordinates) for all clutter meshes within the generated cells and puts them to the specified buffer. Generation of clutter cells is performed in separate threads. Some of the cells may have their lifetime expired. Therefore, the content of certain cells might be unavailable at the moment, such cells are considered as not generated.
member.param: Buffer to store transformations of clutter meshes, in world coordinates.
member.returns: 1, if there are transformations of clutter meshes; or 0, if there are no transformations of clutter meshes found.

member.summary: Collects transformations (in local coordinates) for all clutter meshes within the generated cells and puts them to the specified buffer. Generation of clutter cells is performed in separate threads. Some of the cells may have their lifetime expired. Therefore, the content of certain cells might be unavailable at the moment, such cells are considered as not generated.
member.param: Bounding box, defining the area, for which the transformations of clutter meshes are to be collected.
Buffer to store transformations of clutter meshes, in local coordinates.

Precision flag:1 - transformations will be collected for clutter meshes within the specified bounding box0 - transformations will be collected for clutter meshes within the cells intersected by the specified bounding box

Force flag.1 - regenerate all cells within the area, that were not generated, before collecting transformations for the meshes inside them.0 - transformations will be collected only for the meshes inside the clutter cells, that were generated.
member.returns: 1, if there are transformations of clutter meshes; or 0, if there are no transformations of clutter meshes found.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setCutoutIntersectionMask(int)
member.summary: Sets a new cutout intersection mask. This mask allows you to cut out clutter objects in the areas of intersection with other objects and decals (e.g. can be used to remove vegetation under houses or from the surface of roads projected using decals). Clutter objects will be cut out by objects and decals that have their intersection mask matching this one (one bit at least). To set intersection masks the following methods can be used: for decals use getIntersectionMask() for objects use getIntersectionMask()
member.param: Integer, each bit of which is a mask.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getCutoutIntersectionMask const
member.summary: Returns the current cutout intersection mask. This mask allows you to cut out clutter objects in the areas of intersection with other objects and decals (e.g. can be used to remove vegetation under houses or from the surface of roads projected using decals). Clutter objects will be cut out by objects and decals that have their intersection mask matching this one (one bit at least). To set intersection masks the following methods can be used: for decals use getIntersectionMask() for objects use getIntersectionMask()
member.returns: Integer, each bit of which is a mask.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setCutoutInverse(int)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the clutter objects should be rendered inside or outside the areas determined by the cutout intersection mask.
member.param: 0 to render clutter objects outside the areas determined by the cutout intersection mask; 1 to render the clutter objects inside these areas.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getCutoutInverse const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the clutter objects is rendered inside or outside the areas determined by the cutout intersection mask.
member.returns: 0 if clutter objects are rendered outside the areas determined by the cutout intersection mask; 1 if inside.

member.summary: Adds a triangle fan to the mesh. This method does not add vertices, rather it allocates indices, for which vertices should be then created with the addVertex() function. Indices will point to vertices starting from the current last vertex in the vertex buffer.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshDynamic.addTriangleQuads(int)
member.summary: Adds a given number of quadrilaterals to the mesh. This method does not add vertices, rather it allocates indices, for which vertices should be then created with the addVertex() function. Indices will point to vertices starting from the current last vertex in the vertex buffer.

member.summary: Adds a given number of triangles to the mesh. This method does not add vertices, rather it allocates indices, for which vertices should be then created with the addVertex() function. Indices will point to vertices starting from the current last vertex in the vertex buffer.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshDynamic.addTriangleStrip(int)
member.summary: Adds a triangle strip to the mesh. This method does not add vertices, rather it allocates indices, for which vertices should be then created with the addVertex() function. Indices will point to vertices starting from the current last vertex in the vertex buffer.

member.summary: Flushes the index buffer and sends all data to GPU. This method is called automatically, if the length of the index buffer changes. If you change the contents of the index buffers, you should call this method.

member.summary: Flushes the vertex buffer and sends all data to GPU. This method is called automatically, if the length of the vertex buffer changes. If you change the contents of the vertex buffer, you should call this method.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.#ctor(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh})
member.summary: ObjectMeshSkinned constructor.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.ObjectMeshSkinned(char,bool)
member.summary: ObjectMeshSkinned constructor.
member.param: Path to the skinned mesh file.

When you create several objects out of a single .mesh file, the instance of the mesh geometry is created. If you then change the source geometry, its instances will be changed as well. To avoid this, set the unique flag to true (1), so a copy of the mesh geometry will be created and changes won't be applied.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.setFrame(int,float,int,int)
member.summary: Sets a frame for the given animation layer.
member.param: Frame number in the "from-to" interval. If the float argument is passed, animation is interpolated between nearby frames. 0 means the from frame. For larger values, a residue of a modulo (from-to) is calculated. If a negative value is provided, interpolation will be done from the current frame to the from frame.
Start frame. -1 means the first frame of the animation.
End frame. -1 means the last frame of the animation.
member.returns: The number of the frame.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.getFrame(int) const
member.summary: Returns the frame number passed as the time argument on the last setFrame() call.
member.returns: Frame number.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.getFrameFrom(int) const
member.summary: Returns the start frame passed as the from argument on the last setFrame() call.
member.returns: Start frame.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.getFrameTo(int) const
member.summary: Returns the end frame passed as the to argument on the last setFrame() call.
member.returns: End frame.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.setQuaternion(bool)
member.summary: Enables or disables the dual-quaternion skinning mode. The dual-quaternion model is an accurate, computationally efficient, robust, and flexible method of representing rigid transforms and it is used in skeletal animation. See a Wikipedia article on dual quaternions and a beginners guide to dual-quaternions for more information.
member.param: true to enable dual-quaternion skinning mode, false to disable it.

member.returns: true if dual-quaternion skinning mode is used; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.setTime(float)
member.summary: Sets the animation time, in animation frames. The time count starts from the zero frame. If the time is set to be between frames, animation is blended. If the time is set outside the animation frame range, the animation is looped. The setTime() function corresponds to The Play and Stop options in the editor. In all other cases use setFrame() to set the animation.

member.returns: Animation time.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.addAnimation(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},char)
member.summary: Loads an additional animation from an external file.
member.param: Mesh containing the animation to be added.

The parameter is a virtual unique path defining the animation. After loading the animation clip, its internal representation will be identified by the path when using findAnimation, setAnimation, etc. The default 0 value implies that the names of the animation clips will be used.As the given mesh isn't associated with a file and, therefore, doesn't have path data, the path must be represented by an arbitrary unique string. You can generate a new string and use it as the virtual path for the animation.
member.returns: Animation identifier.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.addAnimation(char)
member.summary: Loads the additional animation from an external file.
member.param: Path to the animation file. The path can be represented by either a path to the file or its GUID, which is the recommended approach. After loading the animation, its internal representation is identified by the path when using findAnimation, setAnimation, etc. When you import your model with animations from an FBX container, the following path to your *.anim files should be used: <path_to_your_fbx_file>/<file.fbx>/<your_anim_file.anim>For example: object->addAnimation("models/soldier/soldier.fbx/run.anim");
member.returns: Animation identifier.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.copyLayer(int,int)
member.summary: Copies source layer bones transformations to the destination layer. The copying conditions are the following: If the destination layer has more bones than the source one, it will keep its former transformations. If the source layer has more bones than destination one, those bones will be added to the destination layer.
member.param: Number of the destination layer in the range from 0 to the total number of animation layers.To get the total number of animation layers, use the getNumLayers() method.
Number of the source layer in range from 0 to the total number of animation layers.To get the total number of animation layers, use the getNumLayers() method.

member.summary: Creates a skinned mesh.
member.param: Dynamic flag:false (0) - If the mesh vertices are changed in run-time, meshes loaded from the same file will be also changed.true (1) - If the mesh vertices are changed in run-time, meshes loaded from the same file won't be changed
member.returns: 1 if the mesh is created successfully; otherwise - 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.setClearOnEnable(bool)
member.summary: Enables or disables re-initialization of the particle system each time it is enabled. When this option is disabled, turning on the particle system will restore the state it had before it was turned off.
