member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.setCollision(int)
member.summary: Enables or disables detecting collision by the outer surface of the sphere that approximates the particles (each particle is approximated with the sphere). This method is slower than intersection detection, but more precise.
member.param: 1 to enable sphere-based collision detection, 0 to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.getCollision const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if collision is detected by the outer surface of the sphere that approximates the particles. This method is slower than sphere center-based intersection detection, but more precise.
member.returns: 1 if the sphere-based collision detection is enabled; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.getContactPoint(int) const

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.getContactVelocity(int) const

member.summary: Returns the current rendering order of the particle system inside the particles hierarchy.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.setEmitterShift(bool)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating if the emitter spawns particles only when it is moving. The further it has moved, if compared to its position in the previous frame, the more particles will be spawned. If the emitter is not moving, there are no particles at all.
member.param: true to enable the shift-based spawning; false to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.isEmitterShift const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the emitter spawns particles only when it is moving. The further it has moved, if compared to its position in the previous frame, the more particles will be spawned. If the emitter is not moving, there are no particles at all.
member.returns: true if the shift-based spawning is enabled; false if it is not.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.setEmitterSize(Unigine.Math.vec3)
member.summary: Sets a size of the emitter.
member.param: A new emitter size. If negative values are provided, 0 will be used instead of them. Depending on the type of the emitter, this value is interpreted as follows:EMITTER_POINT, EMITTER_SPARK, EMITTER_RANDOM: all vector components are ignored.EMITTER_SPHERE: the first vector component is the radius of the sphere.EMITTER_CYLINDER: the first vector component is the radius of the cylinder, the second vector component is the height of the cylinder.EMITTER_BOX: all vector components are interpreted as box dimensions (x, y, z).

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.getEmitterSize const
member.summary: Returns the current emitter size.
member.returns: The current size of the emitter. Depending on the type of the emitter, this value is interpreted as follows:EMITTER_POINT, EMITTER_SPARK, EMITTER_RANDOM: all vector components are ignored.EMITTER_SPHERE: the first vector component is the radius of the sphere.EMITTER_CYLINDER: the first vector component is the radius of the cylinder, the second vector component is the height of the cylinder.EMITTER_BOX: all vector components are interpreted as box dimensions (x, y, z).

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.setEmitterSync(int)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating if a particle system emitter needs to be synchronized to a parent particle system.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.getEmitterSync const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if a particle system emitter is synchronized to a parent particle system.
member.returns: 1 if it is synchronized; otherwise, 0.

member.param: The type of the emitter (one of the EMITTER_* values).

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.getEmitterType const
member.summary: Returns the type (shape) of the emitter.
member.returns: The type of the emitter (one of the EMITTER_* values).

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.setProceduralRendering(bool)
member.summary: Enables particle system rendering to procedural texture to be used by an orthographic decal or a field height. For example, ship wake waves are simulated using this feature.
member.param: 1 to enable rendering to procedural texture, 0 to disable.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.isProceduralRendering const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the procedural rendering enabled or not. This feature enables rendering of particles into an orthographic decal or a field height, and can be used, for example, to create ship wake waves.
member.returns: 1 if the procedural rendering is enabled; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.setProceduralParenting(int)
member.summary: Sets the type of relationship between the particle system and a decal / field node that uses the procedural texture. Procedural rendering must be enabled.
member.param: Relationship type to be used for rendering the particle system to a procedural texture:0 - a decal/field node that uses the procedural texture is a child of the particle system.1 - a decal/field node that uses the procedural texture is a parent of the particle system.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.getProceduralParenting const
member.summary: Returns the current type of relationship between the particle system and a decal / field node that uses the procedural texture. Procedural rendering must be enabled.
member.returns: Relationship type to be used for rendering the particle system to a procedural texture:0 - a decal/field node that uses the procedural texture is a child of the particle system.1 - a decal/field node that uses the procedural texture is a parent of the particle system.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.setProceduralPositioning(int)
member.summary: Sets positioning mode to be used for child nodes using the procedural texture to which the particle system is rendered. Positioning mode can be set only when the particle system is a parent of a decal/field node that uses the procedural texture (parenting mode is set to 0) Procedural rendering must be enabled.
member.param: Mode of the procedural positioning. Can be one of the following:PROCEDURAL_POSITIONING_MANUAL = 0 - position of a child decal/field node, that uses the procedural texture, can be changed manually.PROCEDURAL_POSITIONING_AUTO = 1 - position of a child decal/field node, that uses the procedural texture, is automatically defined by the position of particle system and cannot be changed manually.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.getProceduralPositioning const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating the procedural position mode. Procedural rendering must be enabled.
member.returns: Mode of the procedural positioning. Can be one of the following:PROCEDURAL_POSITIONING_MANUAL = 0PROCEDURAL_POSITIONING_AUTO = 1

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.setProceduralTextureResolution(Unigine.Math.vec3)
member.summary: Sets the resolution of the procedural texture. Procedural rendering must be enabled.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.getProceduralTextureResolution const
member.summary: Returns the resolution of the procedural texture. Procedural rendering must be enabled.
member.returns: Resolution of the texture.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.setSpawnScale(float)
member.summary: Sets a spawn scale that enables to modulate smooth and gradual initialization of the particle system starting with the given spawn state and up to the specified spawn rate.

member.summary: Returns the current spawn scale that enables to modulate smooth and gradual initialization of the particle system starting with the given spawn state and up to the specified spawn rate.

member.summary: Returns the current velocity threshold for spark and random emitters. They spawn particles if velocity of the parent particles is high enough.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.saveStateSelf(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream}) const
member.summary: Saves the object's state to the stream. This method saves all object's parameters, including forces, noises, and deflectors. To save any of these parameters individually, use saveStateForces(), saveStateNoises(), or saveStateDeflectors() respectively. Saving into the stream requires creating a blob to save into. To restore the saved state the restoreStateSelf() method is used:
member.returns: true on success; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectParticles.restoreStateSelf(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream})
member.summary: Restores the object's state from the stream. This method restores all object's parameters, including forces, noises, and deflectors. To restore any of these parameters individually, use restoreStateForces(), restoreStateNoises(), or restoreStateDeflectors() respectively. Restoring from the stream requires creating a blob to save into and saving the state using the saveStateSelf() method:
member.returns: true on success; otherwise, false.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.DEFLECTOR_CLIPPER
member.summary: When a particle hits a deflector of this type, the particle is removed.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.DEFLECTOR_REFLECTOR
member.summary: When a particle hits a deflector of this type, the particle bounces off it.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.EMITTER_BOX
member.summary: Box emitter. Particles are emitted from a random point of the box.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.EMITTER_CYLINDER
member.summary: Cylinder emitter. Particles are emitted from a random point of the cylinder.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.EMITTER_POINT
member.summary: Point emitter. Particles are emitted from one single point.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.EMITTER_RANDOM
member.summary: Arbitrary emitter. Particles are emitted from a random point of their parent node. With an emitter of this type you can create particles, which spawn particles themselves.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.EMITTER_SPARK
member.summary: Spark emitter. Particles are emitted from a single point and imitate sparks.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.EMITTER_SPHERE
member.summary: Sphere emitter. Particles are emitted from a random point of the sphere.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.TYPE_BILLBOARD
member.summary: Particles of this type are camera-oriented and rotating.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.TYPE_CHAIN
member.summary: Particles of this type are camera-oriented and connected with each other at vertices forming continuous flow.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.TYPE_FLAT
member.summary: Particles of this type are perpendicular to the z-axis of their particle system.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.TYPE_LENGTH
member.summary: Particles of this type are similar to billboard particles, but stretched along the direction of their motion and do not rotate.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.TYPE_POINT
member.summary: Particles of this type are similar to billboard particles, but do not rotate.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.TYPE_RANDOM
member.summary: Particles of this type are arbitrary oriented ones.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.TYPE_ROUTE
member.summary: Particles of this type can be used to create tracks from moving objects (for example, foam after a ship). Each Route particle is flat (just like flat particles), but is oriented on the plane in the same way as the emitter when it spawned it.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.SYNC_MODE_SLAVE
member.summary: This mode makes a particle system take the stored synchronization data from the master particle system.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.SYNC_MODE_MASTER
member.summary: This mode enables storing of the particle system data used for synchronization by the slave system.

member.name: F:Unigine.ObjectParticles.SYNC_MODE_NONE
member.summary: In this mode, the particle system neither provides nor takes any synchronization data.

member.name: M:Unigine.ParticleModifier.setMode(ParticleModifier::MODE)
member.summary: Sets the mode of the particle modifier. The mode defines how the controlled value is set. You can switch modes at any time.
member.param: Modifier mode to be set. One of the MODE enum values.

member.name: M:Unigine.ParticleModifier.getMode const
member.summary: Returns the current mode of the particle modifier. The mode defines how the controlled value is set. You can switch modes at any time.
member.returns: Current particle modifier mode. One of the MODE enum values.

member.name: F:Unigine.ParticleModifier.PARTICLE_MODIFIER_SCALAR
member.summary: In this mode the modifier controls a single scalar value via a single curve.

member.name: F:Unigine.ParticleModifier.PARTICLE_MODIFIER_VECTOR
member.summary: In this mode the modifier controls a vector of up to 4 values via a set of curves.

member.name: F:Unigine.ParticleModifier.MODE_CONSTANT
member.summary: In this mode the specified value is fixed throughout the lifetime.

member.name: F:Unigine.ParticleModifier.MODE_RANDOM_BETWEEN_TWO_CONSTANTS
member.summary: In this mode two constants define the upper and lower limits for the value. The actual value changes randomly over time between these limits.

member.name: F:Unigine.ParticleModifier.MODE_CURVE
member.summary: In this mode the modifier controls each value via a single curve.

member.name: F:Unigine.ParticleModifier.MODE_RANDOM_BETWEEN_TWO_CURVES
member.summary: In this mode two curves define the upper and lower limits for the value at each point of the lifetime. The actual value changes randomly over time between these limits.

member.name: F:Unigine.ParticleModifier.NUM_MODES
member.summary: Number of particle modifier's modes.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectTerrainGlobal.setForceIntersection(bool)
member.summary: Enables or disables forced loading of necessary terrain tiles to ensure correct intersection detection. When enabled, this option may significantly reduce performance. Thus, it is recommended to enable it, perform intersection check, and disable it again. It is recommended to make two or more intersection requests to make sure you get the required result when necessary, as in some rare cases forced loading of tiles may not give you a 100% guarantee.
member.param: true to load necessary terrain tiles for intersection detection; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectTerrainGlobal.isForceIntersection const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if forced loading of terrain tiles for intersection detection is enabled. This option is used to enable force loading of terrain tiles to ensure correct intersection detection.
member.returns: false if forced loading of terrain tiles for intersection detection is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Sets the value indicating if the detail uses the mask of the parent detail.

member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the detail uses the mask of the parent detail.

member.summary: Returns the scale of displacement mapping according to the height texture.

member.name: M:Unigine.TerrainGlobalDetail.setDisplacementOffset(float)
member.summary: Sets the displacement offset. This parameter controls the direction of displacement (inward or outward).
member.param: Displacement offset value within the [-1.0f; 1.0f] range.positive value - outward displacement.0 - points corresponding to height texture values less than 0.5 are displaced inwards, others are displaced outwards.negative value - inward displacement.

member.name: M:Unigine.TerrainGlobalDetail.getDisplacementOffset
member.summary: Returns the displacement offset. This parameter controls the direction of displacement (inward or outward).
member.returns: Displacement offset value within the [-1.0f; 1.0f] range.positive value - outward displacement.0 - points corresponding to height texture values less than 0.5 are displaced inwards, others ar edisplaced outwards.negative value - inward displacement.

member.name: M:Unigine.TerrainGlobalDetail.setMaxFadeDistance(float)
member.summary: Sets the maximum fade-out distance of the detail. Over this distance the detail smoothly becomes invisible due to alpha fading. It is counted starting from the maximum visibility distance.
member.param: Maximum fade-out distance, in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.TerrainGlobalDetail.getMaxFadeDistance
member.summary: Returns the maximum fade-out distance of the detail. Over this distance the detail smoothly becomes invisible due to alpha fading. It is counted starting from the maximum visibility distance.
member.returns: Maximum fade-out distance, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.TerrainGlobalDetail.setMaxFadeHeight(float)
member.summary: Sets the fade out height range for the detail mask. Over this height range above the maximum height value the detail mask will fade out until it is completely invisible. This parameter is used to modulate the detail mask by height.
member.param: Fade out height range value for the mask, in units. The default value is 0. Higher values provide smoother fade out.

member.name: M:Unigine.TerrainGlobalDetail.getMaxFadeHeight
member.summary: Returns the fade out height range for the detail mask. Over this height range above the maximum height value the detail mask will fade out until it is completely invisible. This parameter is used to modulate the detail mask by height.
member.returns: Fade out height range value for the mask, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.TerrainGlobalDetail.setMaxVisibleDistance(float)
member.summary: Sets the maximum visibility distance of the detail. It is the distance, starting from which the detail begins to fade out until it becomes completely invisible. This parameter can be used to improve performance and reduce the tiling effect when looking at the terrain from a large distance.
member.param: Maximum visibility distance, in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead. The default value is inf.

member.name: M:Unigine.TerrainGlobalDetail.getMaxVisibleDistance
member.summary: Returns the maximum visibility distance of the detail. It is the distance, starting from which the detail begins to fade out until it becomes completely invisible.
member.returns: Maximum visibility distance, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.TerrainGlobalDetail.setMaxVisibleHeight(float)
member.summary: Sets the maximum height value for the detail mask, starting from which the detail begins to fade out until it becomes completely invisible. This parameter is used to modulate the detail mask by height.
member.param: Maximum height value for the mask, in units. The default value is inf.

member.name: M:Unigine.TerrainGlobalDetail.getMaxVisibleHeight
member.summary: Sets the maximum height value for the detail mask, starting from which the detail begins to fade out until it becomes completely invisible. This parameter is used to modulate the detail mask by height.
member.returns: Maximum height value for the mask, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.TerrainGlobalDetail.setMinFadeDistance(float)
member.summary: Sets the minimum fade-in distance of the detail. Over this distance the detail smoothly becomes visible due to alpha fading. It is counted starting from the minimum visibility distance.
member.param: Minimum fade-in distance, in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.TerrainGlobalDetail.getMinFadeDistance
member.summary: Returns the minimum fade-in distance of the detail. Over this distance the detail smoothly becomes visible due to alpha fading. It is counted starting from the minimum visibility distance.
member.returns: Minimum fade-in distance, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.TerrainGlobalDetail.setMinFadeHeight(float)
member.summary: Sets the fade in height range for the detail mask. Over this height range below the minimum height value the detail mask will fade in until it is completely visible. This parameter is used to modulate the detail mask by height.
member.param: Fade in height range value for the mask, in units. The default value is 0. Higher values provide smoother fade in.

member.name: M:Unigine.TerrainGlobalDetail.getMinFadeHeight
member.summary: Returns the fade in height range for the detail mask. Over this height range below the minimum height value the detail mask will fade in until it is completely visible. This parameter is used to modulate the detail mask by height.
member.returns: Fade in height range value for the mask, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.TerrainGlobalDetail.setMinVisibleDistance(float)
member.summary: Sets the minimum visibility distance of the detail. It is the distance, starting from which the detail begins to fade in until it becomes completely visible. This parameter can be used to improve performance and reduce the tiling effect when looking at the terrain from a large distance.
member.param: Minimum visibility distance, in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead. The default value is -inf.

member.name: M:Unigine.TerrainGlobalDetail.getMinVisibleDistance
member.summary: Returns the minimum visibility distance of the detail. It is the distance, starting from which the detail begins to fade in until it becomes completely visible.
member.returns: Minimum visibility distance, in units.

member.param: Minimum height value for the mask, in units. The default value is -inf.

member.name: M:Unigine.TerrainGlobalDetail.getMinVisibleHeight
member.summary: Returns the minimum height value for the detail mask, starting from which the detail begins to fade in until it becomes completely visible. This parameter is used to modulate the detail mask by height.
member.returns: Minimum height value for the mask, in units.

member.summary: Fetches the data for the point on the terrain with given coordinates and puts it to the specified output structure.
member.param: X coordinate of the point on the terrain.
Y coordinate of the point on the terrain.
Output Pixel structure to store the pixel color.

Force flag.If 1 is specified, the data will be fetched immediately.If 0 is specified, the operation will be queued to a separate thread.It is recommended to set this flag to 0 when possible to avoid spikes..
member.returns: 1 if the data for the specified pixel was fetched successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.param: 1 to enable the outline; 0 to disable.

member.summary: Returns the flag indicating if the text outline is enabled.
member.returns: 1 the outline is enabled; 0 disabled.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectText.setFontResolution(int)
member.summary: Sets the resolution of the texture into which the text will be rendered. The lower the value, the less detailed will be the text, the less video memory will be required for the texture. It doesn't influence the text's physical size.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectText.getFontResolution const
member.summary: Returns the text resolution value.
member.returns: The text resolution value.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectText.setFontRich(int)
member.summary:
Sets the flag indicating if the rich text is enabled. When enabled, the following tags can be used for text formatting: text specifies a bold text. text specifies an italic text.
text
inserts a single line break. text left-aligns the text. text right-aligns the text.
text
center-aligns the text.

text

specifies the alignment of the text within a paragraph: left - left-aligns the text right - right-aligns the text center - center-aligns the text justify - stretches the lines so that each line has equal width (like in newspapers and magazines) Text alignment requires text wrapping to be enabled: the value of the Wrap Width parameter must be greater than 0. text specifies the font face, font size, and color of text. text defines subscript text. Subscript text appears half a character below the normal line, and is sometimes rendered in a smaller font. text defines superscript text. Superscript text appears half a character above the normal line, and is sometimes rendered in a smaller font. and tags are not available.
member.param: 1 to enable the rich text; 0 to disable.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectText.getFontRich const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the rich text is enabled. When enabled, tags can be used for text formatting.
member.returns: 1 the rich text is enabled; 0 disabled.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectText.setFontSize(int)
member.summary: Sets the size of the text font. The more dots, the higher the size of the font. To match dots with a 3D space, there is a set value: 288 dots per unit. For example, if you have the Arial font with the size of 20, the physical height of the letter can be calculated as 20/288=0.0694 units.
member.param: The size of the text, in dots.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectText.getFontSize const
member.summary: Returns the text font size.
member.returns: The text font size, in dots.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectText.setFontVSpacing(int)
member.summary: Sets the vertical spacing between letters (kerning value). This parameter influences the text's physical size.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectText.getFontVSpacing const
member.summary: Returns the vertical spacing between letters (kerning value).
member.returns: The vertical spacing, in dots.

member.summary: Returns the color of the text.
member.returns: The text color in the RGBA range.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterMesh.setWave(int,Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Sets parameters for one of four simulated water waves.
member.param: Wave parameters:The X and Y components containing the velocity of the wave.The Z component containing the frequency.The W component containing the amplitude.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterMesh.getWave(int)
member.summary: Returns parameters of one of four simulated water waves.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterMesh.setWaveAngle(int,float)
member.summary: Sets direction (angle of spreading) for a given wave: If 0 is specified, the wave spreads along the Y axis and is parallel to the X axis. If a positive value is specified, the wave direction is slanted counterclockwise relative to its initial spread. If a negative value is specified, the wave is rotated clockwise.
member.param: Angle, in degrees. Both positive and negative values are acceptable.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterMesh.getWaveAngle(int)
member.summary: Returns direction (angle of spreading) of a given wave.
member.returns: Angle, in degrees.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterMesh.setWaveHeight(int,float)
member.summary: Sets the distance between the highest and the lowest peaks for the given wave. It sets the wave form along with the setWaveLength() function. The higher the value is, the higher the waves are.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterMesh.getWaveHeight(int)
member.summary: Returns the distance between the highest and the lowest peaks for the given wave.
member.returns: Height, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterMesh.setWaveLength(int,float)
member.summary: Sets the distance between successive crests for the given wave. The higher the length value is, the broader the waves are.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterMesh.getWaveLength(int)
member.summary: Returns the distance between successive crests of the given wave.
member.returns: Length, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterMesh.setWaveSpeed(int,float)
member.summary: Sets a speed for a given wave. The higher the value, the faster waves follow each other.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterMesh.getWaveSpeed(int)
member.summary: Returns the speed of a given wave.
member.returns: Speed, in units per second.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterMesh.loadMesh(char)
member.summary: Loads a mesh for the current water mesh from the file. This function doesn't change the mesh name.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterMesh.saveMesh(char)
member.summary: Saves the object water mesh into a file.
member.returns: 1 if the mesh is saved successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.summary: Sets a value indicating if the global water object is active. If there are more than one global water nodes in the scene, only the active one will be rendered.
member.param: true to set the global water object as active, false - to set it as inactive.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.isActiveWater const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the global water object is active.
member.returns: true if the global water object is active, false - if it is inactive.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.fetchHeight(Unigine.Math.Vec3) const
member.summary: Returns a height offset of the specified point relative to the current water level calculated at this point. E.g. in case the specified point is (0, 0, -3) and the current water level calculated for this point is equal to 5, the function shall return 8. In case of higher Beaufort levels (resulting in significant wave steepness and height differences on the water surface), calculation results may differ from visual representation (e.g. calculated water level may be greater the actual value). To avoid it and increase precision, adjust calculation quality.
member.returns: Height offset of the specified point relative to the current water level calculated at this point, in meters.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.fetchNormal(Unigine.Math.Vec3) const
member.summary: Returns a normal vector to the water surface at the specified point (to orient objects along the waves normals).In case of higher Beaufort levels (resulting in significant wave steepness and height differences on the water surface), calculation results may differ from visual representation (e.g. calculated water level may be greater the actual value). To avoid it and increase precision, adjust calculation quality.
member.returns: Normal vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.setFetchAmplitudeThreshold(float)
member.summary: Sets the threshold for amplitude values that will not participate in height and normal calculations. The more you cut off, the less accurate the height value you get, but the faster are the calculations.
member.param: Amplitude threshold. The default value is 0.1f.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.getFetchAmplitudeThreshold const
member.summary: Returns the current threshold for amplitude values that will not participate in height and normal calculations.
member.returns: Amplitude threshold.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.setFetchSteepnessQuality(ObjectWaterGlobal::STEEPNESS_QUALITY)
member.summary: Sets the wave steepness calculation quality used in height and normal calculations. Low quality is usually sufficient for calm water and large floating objects. If the waves are big, or you want to simulate small floating objects, you may need to increase the quality. Higher quality gives a more precise result but affects performance.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.getFetchSteepnessQuality const
member.summary: Returns the wave steepness calculation quality used in height and normal calculations.
member.returns: Steepness quality. The default is STEEPNESS_QUALITY_LOW.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.getIntersectionAmplitudeThreshold const
member.summary: Returns the current threshold of amplitude values that will not participate in intersection calculations.
member.returns: Amplitude threshold.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.setIntersectionAmplitudeThreshold(float)
member.summary: Sets the threshold for amplitude values that will not participate in intersection calculations. The default value is 0.1f.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.setIntersectionPrecision(float)
member.summary: Sets an intersection precision which represents an error between the real value of the water intersection point and the calculated value. The default value is 0.25.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.getIntersectionPrecision const
member.summary: Returns current intersection precision which represents an error between the real value of the water intersection point and the calculated value.
member.returns: Precision for intersection detection.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.setIntersectionSteepnessQuality(ObjectWaterGlobal::STEEPNESS_QUALITY)
member.summary: Sets the wave steepness calculation quality used in intersection calculations. Low quality is usually sufficient for calm water and large floating objects. If the waves are big, or you want to simulate small floating objects, you may need to increase the quality. Higher quality gives a more precise result but affects performance.
member.param: Steepness quality. The default is STEEPNESS_QUALITY_LOW.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.getIntersectionSteepnessQuality const
member.summary: Returns the wave steepness calculation quality used in intersection calculations. Low quality is usually sufficient for calm water and large floating objects. If the waves are big, or you want to simulate small floating objects, you may need to increase the quality. Higher quality gives a more precise result but affects performance.
member.returns: Steepness quality.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.setReflectionOcclusion(float)
member.summary: Sets the occlusion factor for environment reflections on parts of the water surface with negative normals. Using this parameter enables simulation of reflection of waves on the water surface removing too bright areas on waves close to the horizon.
member.param: Occlusion value. Minimum value is 0 - no occlusion. By the higher values, occlusion is performed for reflections on parts of the water surface with negative normals that have a certain slope. The higher the value, the less intensive reflections are on the surface parts with negative normals.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.getReflectionOcclusion const
member.summary: Returns the current occlusion factor for environment reflections on parts of the water surface with negative normals. Using this parameter enables simulation of reflection of waves on the water surface removing too bright areas on waves close to the horizon.
member.returns: Occlusion value.

member.summary: Sets the slope of negative normals of the water surface, at which occlusion is performed for wave reflections.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.getReflectionOcclusionSlope const
member.summary: Returns the current slope of negative normals of the water surface, at which occlusion is performed for wave reflections.
member.returns: Slope value.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.setPlanarReflection(bool)
member.summary: Enables/disables the use of planar reflections on the water surface instead of SSR. It is better to use this option for undisturbed water (0-2 Beaufort). Enabling the option activates Planar Reflection MapSize and Planar Reflection parameters.
member.param: true to enable planar reflections, false to disable them.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.isPlanarReflection const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the planar reflections option is enabled.
member.returns: true if planar reflections option is enabled, otherwise, false.

member.summary: Sets the size of the planar reflection map. The higher the value, the better the quality is.
member.param: Size of the planar reflection map.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.getPlanarReflectionMapSizeType const
member.summary: Returns the current size of the planar reflection map.
member.returns: Size of the planar reflection map.

member.summary: Sets the viewport mask of the reflection camera. A surface has its reflection rendered, if its viewport mask and its material's viewport mask match this mask.

member.summary: Enables/disables the effect of light rays refraction by the water surface.
member.param: true to enable the caustics, false to disable them.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.isCaustics const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the caustics effect is enabled.
member.returns: true if the caustics effect is enabled, otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.setCausticsDistortion(bool)
member.summary: Enables/disables the caustics distortion option. This effect removes pixelation and makes caustics look smoother. When smoothing is not required, you can disable this option to gain performance.
member.param: true to enable caustics distortion, false to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.isCausticsDistortion const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the caustics distortion effect is enabled.
member.returns: true if caustics distortion is enabled, otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.setFieldShorelineEnabled(bool)
member.summary: Enables/disables the effect of the FieldShoreline object on the Global Water object. Enabling this option makes available the group of Field Shoreline states.
member.param: true to enable FieldShoreline, false to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.isFieldShorelineEnabled const
member.summary: Checks if the assigned material on the Global Water object has enabled FieldShoreline interaction option.
member.returns: true if the FieldShoreline interaction option is enabled, otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.setFieldShorelineHighPrecision(bool)
member.summary: Enables/disables improved interpolation between the adjacent pixels of the shoreline texture to reduce stepping artifacts. This can be noticed when looking at the waterline separating overwater and underwater. This option should be used only when geometry and/or normal states are enabled.
member.param: true to enable high precision, false to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.isFieldShorelineHighPrecision const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the high precision of the shoreline is enabled. If enabled, this option improves interpolation between the adjacent pixels of the shoreline texture to reduce stepping artifacts.
member.returns: true if high precision is enabled, otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.setFieldShorelineNormal(bool)
member.summary: Enables/disables calculation of normals for geometry of shoreline waves. This option significantly reduces performance and can be used in cases, when really large waves are required. Enabling just the geometry state to simulate distortion of the water surface by a shoreline wave is enough in most cases.
member.param: true to enable, false to disable.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.isFieldShorelineNormal const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if calculation of normals for geometry of shoreline waves is enabled.
member.returns: true if enabled, otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.setFieldShorelineGeometry(bool)
member.summary: Enables/disables rendering of wave geometry for shoreline waves. If disabled, the water surface remains flat. Disabling this option in cases where wave geometry is hardly noticeable (e.g. a flight simulator) gives a performance gain.
member.param: true to enable, false to disable.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.isFieldShorelineGeometry const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if rendering of wave geometry for shoreline waves is enabled.
member.returns: true if enabled, otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.setFieldShorelineFoam(bool)
member.summary: Enables/disables rendering of foam for shoreline zones.
member.param: true to enable, false to disable.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.isFieldShorelineFoam const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if rendering of foam for shoreline zones is enabled.
member.returns: true if enabled, otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.setAuxiliary(bool)
member.summary: Enables/disables the auxiliary rendering pass for the material. Can be used for custom post-effects, such as thermal vision, night vision, etc. Enabling the option activates the Auxiliary Color parameter.
member.param: true to enable, false to disable.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.isAuxiliary const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the auxiliary rendering pass for the material is enabled.
member.returns: true if enabled, otherwise, false.

member.param: true to enable, false to disable.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.isFieldHeightEnabled const
member.summary: Checks if the assigned material on the Global Water object has enabled FieldHeight interaction option.
member.returns: true if the FieldHeight interaction option is enabled, otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.setFieldSpacerEnabled(bool)
member.summary: Enables/disables the effect of FieldSpacer object on the Global Water object.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.isFieldSpacerEnabled const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the effect of FieldSpacer object on the Global Water object is enabled.
member.returns: true if enabled, otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.setWavesSpeedScale(float)
member.summary: Sets a scale value that affects the speed of all the waves. The resulting wave speed is calculated as sqrt(gravity * 2 * pi / wave_length) * waves_speed_scale, where gravity = 9.81 m/s2.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObjectWaterGlobal.getWavesSpeedScale const
member.summary: Returns the current scale value that affects the speed of all the waves.
member.returns: Scale value.
